Supposing* we go to one of the two local commercial stations and get time on the

This procedure, I think, would have the advantage of combining the motivation
to be derived from going on the air with actual workshop conditions. One reason
that X like this idea is that the symphony television project which is now in full
swing is giving us at KUOM the best chance to learn television production we’ve ever
had. As of the moment, Dawson, Irv Fink, Holmberg, several of our engineers and
several of our miscellaneous employees and I are putting in what amounts to full time
on the series; and other members of our staff are going to be in on it before very
long. Just last night, for example, Brets and I worked for three hours choosing
camera shots for the first movement of the Schubert Unfinished Symphony. All of this
has been teaching us a great deal about television production and is doing so much
better than if we were getting ready for a kinescope or a closed circuit presentation.
